Description¶

General OpenMaya API operations.

Operations defined within this module have low level objectives which are designed to be utilised by higher level abstractions of the OpenMaya API. Operations include direct retrieval, validation and filtering of OpenMaya objects.

The following notes/warnings discuss a variety of edge cases or unusual behaviours that are directly associated with the OpenMaya API.

If a specific behaviour arises from a higher level abstraction of an OpenMaya operation, that behaviour may be documented in a seperate msTools utility module.

M*Array classes¶

Note

  1. Maya uses reference semantics for arrays of class type meaning item access will return direct references to elements. However Maya does not provide reference counting for these elements.

Warning

  1. Do not directly assign an OpenMaya object which enters the current scope via an OpenMaya array.
def foo(node):
    # Maya might crash if we operate on `path`
    # The OpenMaya.MDagPath referenced by `path` may already be destroyed if it was never reference counted
    path = OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo(node)[0]

def bar(node):
    # Even if the OpenMaya.MDagPath assigned to `path` is not reference counted it is still valid whilst `array` is alive
    array = OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo(node)
    path = array[0]

Warning

  1. Do not return an OpenMaya object from a local scope if the object entered the scope via an OpenMaya array.
def foo(node):
    # The OpenMaya.MDagPath assigned to `path` is valid whilst `array` is alive
    array = OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo(node)
    path = array[0]
    return path

def bar(node):
    # The OpenMaya.MDagPath assigned to `path` is completely decoupled from the OpenMaya.MDagPathArray
    array = OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo(node)
    path = OpenMaya.MDagPath(array[0])
    return path

def foobar(node):
    # The OpenMaya.MDagPaths assigned to `paths` are completely decoupled from the OpenMaya.MDagPathArray
    # This is similiar to making a deepcopy of the OpenMaya.MDagPathArray
    # Note, in-place list comprehension is safe since items are copied before the OpenMaya.MDagPathArray is destroyed
    return [OpenMaya.MDagPath(p) for p in OpenMaya.MDagPath.getAllPathsTo(node)]

# Maya might crash if we operate on `path`
# The OpenMaya.MDagPath returned from `foo()` may have been destroyed if it was never reference counted
path = foo(node)

# The OpenMaya.MDagPath assigned to `path` is valid and reference counted
path = bar(node)

# The OpenMaya.MDagPaths assigned to `paths` are valid and reference counted
paths = foobar(node)

OpenMaya.MDagPath¶

Note

  1. Checking a node for Function Set support produces potentially differing results when using an OpenMaya.MDagPath versus an OpenMaya.MObject. An OpenMaya.MDagPath which references a transform will support Function Set types which are compatible with any of its child shape nodes. For example a transform which is the parent of a mesh shape will support OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh via OpenMaya.MDagPath.hasFn() but not via OpenMaya.MObject.hasFn().

Warning

  1. The isValid() state of an OpenMaya.MDagPath is not reflective of whether the path references a valid dependency node. Rather this value indicates whether the path was constructed with a valid reference to a dependency node.

OpenMaya.MDGModifier¶

Warning

  1. Always use an OpenMaya.MDagModifier to operate on DAG nodes. Deleting an instanced DAG node with an OpenMaya.MDGModifier can cause Maya’s internal state to become invalid. Only the first instance will be removed making it impossible to delete others from the GUI.

OpenMaya.MDagModifier¶

Warning

  1. Never use an OpenMaya.MDagModifier to delete an instanced DAG node. Deleting an instanced DAG node with an OpenMaya.MDagModifier can result in ancestors being deleted. Instead it is best to use Maya commands.

OpenMaya.MItDag¶

Note

  1. Setting the root of an OpenMaya.MItDag iterator to an OpenMaya.MObject that points to an instanced node will not traverse its descendant hierarchy. Always use an OpenMaya.MDagPath as the root object if traversal of all descendant nodes is required.

OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph¶

Note

  1. The documentation for OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph.resetTo() has an error. If an OpenMaya.MIteratorType is used, it must be the second argument.

OpenMaya.MObject¶

Note

  1. An OpenMaya.MObject acts as a wrapper for an internal Maya object such as a node or attribute.

Warning

  1. The isNull() state of an OpenMaya.MObject is not reflective of whether an internal Maya object is valid. Rather this value indicates whether the wrapper was constructed with a valid reference to an internal Maya object.

OpenMaya.MObjectHandle¶

Warning

  1. The isValid() state of an OpenMaya.MObjectHandle holding an OpenMaya.MObject wrapper of a node indicates whether the node exists in the dependency graph.

Warning

  1. The isValid() state of an OpenMaya.MObjectHandle holding an OpenMaya.MObject wrapper of an attribute will always be True. Consider that an attribute remains functional even when it is not directly referenced by any dependency node plug. For example it can be used to instantiate a plug via OpenMaya.MDGModifier.addAttribute().

OpenMaya.MPlug¶

Note

  1. In order to explicitly compare two OpenMaya.MPlug instances, the logical indices of each ancestor plug need to be compared. It is not sufficient to just compare the logical indices of two descendant plugs. For example ancestor[0].child[0] would be considered equivalent to ancestor[1].child[0] if just the child indices were compared.

Note

  1. When retrieving the name of a plug via OpenMaya.MPlug.partialName(), there are two arguments that should be included to ensure the name is explicit for all cases:
    • includeNonMandatoryIndices: Ensures indices are included in the names of element plugs whose attribute is not marked as indexMatters. See OpenMaya.MFnAttribute.indexMatters.
    • includeInstancedIndices: Ensures indices are included in the names of element plugs whose attribute is marked as world space (eg. worldMatrix[0]). See OpenMaya.MFnAttribute.worldSpace.

Warning

  1. The isNull state of an OpenMaya.MPlug is not reflective of whether the plug references a valid dependency node plug. Rather this value indicates whether the plug was constructed with valid references to a dependency node and attribute.

Warning

  1. An OpenMaya.MPlug will be given placeholder indices if it is initialised with an OpenMaya.MObject which is referencing an attribute that is the child of a compound array attribute. The OpenMaya.MPlug state is valid since each OpenMaya.MObject points to a valid internal Maya object. However functionally this OpenMaya.MPlug is invalid since it does not reference a specific plug in the dependency graph.

Warning

  1. An OpenMaya.MPlug can be initialised with OpenMaya.MObject instances that reference unrelated internal attribute and node objects. The OpenMaya.MPlug state is valid since each OpenMaya.MObject points to a valid internal Maya object. However functionally this OpenMaya.MPlug is invalid since it does not reference a specific plug in the dependency graph.

OpenMaya.MSelectionList¶

Note

  1. When adding a node via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.add(), the searchPathsAndNamespaces argument defines the behaviour of the search.
    • If False, the name must include any identifying path and namespace with format '|:namespace:ancestor|:namespace:child'.
    • If True, the name can be a short name with format 'child' or a partial path with format 'ancestor|child'. The search will be extended to ancestors and namespaces. Selection will preference namespaced nodes. For example if there are two nodes with the same short name but only one is namespaced, the namespaced node will be added first.

Note

  1. When adding a plug or component via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.add(), the searchPathsAndNamespaces argument does not affect the search.
    • A single object will be selected if a node can be uniquely identified within the name.
    • Multiple objects will be selected if a node cannot be not uniquely identified within the name (order of selection is unclear).

Note

  1. Adding an array plug which references an ‘instanced’ OpenMaya.MFnAttribute.worldSpace attribute will produce an indexed element plug. For example adding 'transform.worldMatrix' will produce a plug corresponding to 'transform.worldMatrix[0]' when accessed via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.getPlug().
class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MDGModifier¶

Bases: object

Composition class for registering an internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier with an OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Upon calling doIt() any registered OpenMaya.MDGModifier operations are executed via an undo/redo capable OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Refer to OpenMaya.MDGModifier for supported operations. Two amendments are made to the public interface:

  • doIt(): Reimplements OpenMaya.MDGModifier.doIt().
  • undoIt(): Prevents access to OpenMaya.MDGModifier.undoIt().

Note

Once doIt() is called, the modifier instance becomes inaccessible. Ownership of the internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier is transferred to the OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Example

# Create a network node using the OpenMaya API
mod = MDGModifier()
mod.createNode('network')
mod.doIt()
# Undo via the Maya command interface
maya.cmds.undo()
__getattribute__(name)¶

Attempts to return the attribute name from the MDGModifier instance. If the attribute is not found the search is extended to the internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier instance.

Raises:
  • AttributeError – If name does not exist on the MDGModifier instance or the internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier instance.
  • RuntimeError – If MDGModifier.doIt() has been called.
Returns:

any – Object bound to name.
__init__()¶

Initialize the modifier before registering operations.

doIt()¶

Execute any operations which have been applied to the internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier and register them with an undoable command.

Raises:RuntimeError – If MDGModifier.doIt() has already been called.
undoIt()¶

Prevents access to OpenMaya.MDGModifier.undoIt() which is inherited by the internal OpenMaya.MDGModifier instance.

Raises:NotImplementedError – If this method is called.
class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MDagModifier¶

Bases: object

Composition class for registering an internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier with an OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Upon calling doIt() any registered OpenMaya.MDagModifier operations are executed via an undo/redo capable OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Refer to OpenMaya.MDagModifier and its base OpenMaya.MDGModifier for supported operations. Two amendments are made to the public interface:

  • doIt(): Reimplements OpenMaya.MDGModifier.doIt().
  • undoIt(): Prevents access to OpenMaya.MDGModifier.undoIt().

Note

Once doIt() is called, the modifier instance becomes inaccessible. Ownership of the internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier is transferred to the OpenMaya.MPxCommand.

Example

# Create a transform node using the OpenMaya API
mod = MDagModifier()
mod.createNode('transform')
mod.doIt()
# Undo via the Maya command interface
maya.cmds.undo()
__getattribute__(name)¶

Attempts to return the attribute name from the MDagModifier instance. If the attribute is not found the search is extended to the internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier instance.

Raises:
  • AttributeError – If name does not exist on the MDagModifier instance or the internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier instance.
  • RuntimeError – If MDagModifier.doIt() has been called.
Returns:

any – Object bound to name.
__init__()¶

Initialize the modifier before registering operations.

doIt()¶

Execute any operations which have been applied to the internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier and register them with an undoable command.

Raises:RuntimeError – If MDagModifier.doIt() has already been called.
undoIt()¶

Prevents access to OpenMaya.MDGModifier.undoIt() which is inherited by the internal OpenMaya.MDagModifier instance.

Raises:NotImplementedError – If this method is called.
class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MDagPathSet(iterable=None)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet

Compile an ordered set of unique OpenMaya.MDagPath instances.

The interface is inherited from msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet which provides templated functionality based on the DATA_TYPE. Designed to mimic a set whilst internally data is compiled through equality testing instead of a hash table. Expect operations to run in O(n) time compared to their set counterparts which are likely to run in O(1) time.

Example

path0 = getPathByName('|node0')
path1 = getPathByName('|node1')

# Initialize a set with `path0`
mPathSet = MDagPathSet([path0])

# Set already contains `path0`, returns `False`
assert not mPathSet.add(path0)
# Add `path1`, returns `True`
assert mPathSet.add(path1)
# Set contains `path0` and `path1`
assert len(mPathSet) == 2
DATA_TYPE¶

alias of OpenMaya.MDagPath

class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MObjectSet(iterable=None)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet

Compile an ordered set of unique OpenMaya.MObject instances.

The interface is inherited from msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet which provides templated functionality based on the DATA_TYPE. Designed to mimic a set whilst internally data is compiled through equality testing instead of a hash table. Expect operations to run in O(n) time compared to their set counterparts which are likely to run in O(1) time.

Example

node0 = getNodeByName('node0')
node1 = getNodeByName('node1')

# Initialize a set with `node0`
mObjSet = MObjectSet([node0])

# Set already contains `node0`, returns `False`
assert not mObjSet.add(node0)
# Add `node1`, returns `True`
assert mObjSet.add(node1)
# Set contains `node0` and `node1`
assert len(mObjSet) == 2
DATA_TYPE¶

alias of OpenMaya.MObject

class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId¶

Bases: msTools.core.maya.om_utils._MPlugId

An OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation which provides an explicit approach to equality comparisons.

Provided as an alternative to OpenMaya.MPlug.__eq__() and OpenMaya.MPlug.__ne__() which both complete comparisons via attributes and nodes. For instances of this class, comparisons are completed via attributes, nodes and logical indices (including ancestral logical indices).

Note

Instances of this class maintain a unique reference to their encapsulated OpenMaya.MPlug to ensure the referenced dependency node plug does not change. This enables the logical indices of the OpenMaya.MPlug to be cached for efficient comparison.

plug¶

Get a copy of the encapsulated dependency node plug.

Type:OpenMaya.MPlug
indexPath¶

Get a copy of the logical index cache that plots the ancestral path to the root of plug.

Type:list [int]

Example

# Comparison evaluates `True`
getPlugByName('node.plug[0]') == getPlugByName('node.plug[1]')

# Comparison evaluates `False`
MPlugId(getPlugByName('node.plug[0]')) == MPlugId(getPlugByName('node.plug[1]'))
__getattribute__(name)¶

x.__getattribute__(name) <==> x.name.

static __new__(cls, plug)¶

Instantiate an object.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Plug to encapsulate.
__repr__()¶

x.__repr__() <==> repr(x).

Returns:str – A string representation of the dependency node plug encapsulation.
class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugSet(iterable=None)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet

Compile an ordered set of unique OpenMaya.MPlug instances.

The interface is inherited from msTools.core.py.structures.EqualitySet which provides templated functionality based on the DATA_TYPE. Designed to mimic a set whilst internally data is compiled through equality testing instead of a hash table. Expect operations to run in O(n) time compared to their set counterparts which are likely to run in O(1) time.

Note

Internally, each input is encapsulated by an MPlugId to ensure equality checks are explicit.

Example

plug0 = getPlugByName('node.plug[0]')
plug1 = getPlugByName('node.plug[1]')

# Initialize a set with `plug0`
mPlugSet = MPlugSet([plug0])

# Set already contains `plug0`, returns `False`
assert not mPlugSet.add(plug0)
# Add `plug1`, returns `True`
assert mPlugSet.add(plug1)
# Set contains `plug0` and `plug1`
assert len(mPlugSet) == 2
DATA_TYPE¶

alias of OpenMaya.MPlug

class msTools.core.maya.om_utils.Modifier¶

Bases: object

Abstract baseclass for defining undoable operations in Maya.

Initializing this baseclass for any subclassed instance will register the interface with an OpenMaya.MPxCommand. The command makes use of two abstract methods implemented by the subclass:

  • doIt(): Modify the state of Maya.
  • undoIt(): Undo or reverse the changes made by doIt().

Example

class LockPlug(Modifier):
    def __init__(self, plug):
        self._plug = plug
        super(LockPlug, self).__init__()

    def doIt(self):
        self._oldLockState = self._plug.isLocked
        self._plug.isLocked = True

    def undoIt(self):
        self._plug.isLocked = self._oldLockState

# Lock `plug` using the OpenMaya API
LockPlug(plug)
# Undo via the Maya command interface
maya.cmds.undo()
__init__()¶

Initializes the modifier and registers it with an OpenMaya.MPxCommand. The command immediately calls doIt() upon being registered.

doIt()¶

Modify the state of Maya.

Note

Abstract method - must be overriden by each subclass.

undoIt()¶

Undo or reverse the changes made by doIt().

Note

Abstract method - must be overriden by each subclass.

msTools.core.maya.om_utils.createIteratorTypeFilter(objectType=0, filterTypes=None)¶

Instantiate an OpenMaya.MIteratorType object for use with either OpenMaya.MItDag, OpenMaya.MItDependencyGraph or OpenMaya.MItDependencyNodes.

Parameters:
  • objectType (int, optional) – Type constant from OpenMaya.MIteratorType corresponding to the type of root object that will be used by the iterator. Valid values are kMObject, kMDagPathObject, kMPlug. Defaults to kMObject.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn used to filter the type of objects generated by the iterator. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MIteratorType – Object used to filter the type of objects generated by the iterator.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.filterObjectWrappersByType(objs, filterTypes=None)¶

Filter OpenMaya.MObject wrappers of internal Maya objects based on their compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn.

Parameters:
  • objs (iterable [OpenMaya.MObject]) – Wrappers of internal Maya objects.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Filtered objs.

Example

# Returns object wrappers that reference non-mesh shape nodes
filterObjectWrappersByType(objs, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kShape, -OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh))
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.filterPathsByNodeType(paths, filterTypes=None)¶

Filter OpenMaya.MDagPath objects based on their internal OpenMaya.MObject compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn.

Parameters:
  • paths (iterable [OpenMaya.MDagPath]) – Path encapsulations of DAG nodes.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] – Filtered paths.

Example

# Returns paths which reference non-mesh shape nodes
filterPathsByNodeType(paths, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kShape, -OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh))
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.filterPathsByType(paths, filterTypes=None)¶

Filter OpenMaya.MDagPath objects based on their compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn.

Parameters:
  • paths (iterable [OpenMaya.MDagPath]) – Path encapsulations of DAG nodes.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MDagPath] – Filtered paths.

Example

# Returns paths which reference non-mesh shape nodes or transforms with child non-mesh shape nodes
filterPathsByType(paths, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kShape, -OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh))
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.filterPlugsByAttributeType(plugs, filterTypes=None)¶

Filter OpenMaya.MPlug objects based on their internal OpenMaya.MObject attribute compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn.

Parameters:
  • plugs (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kCompoundAttribute. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Filtered plugs.

Example

# Returns plugs which reference non-compound attributes
filterPlugsByNodeType(paths, filterTypes=(-OpenMaya.MFn.kCompoundAttribute,))
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.filterPlugsByNodeType(plugs, filterTypes=None)¶

Filter OpenMaya.MPlug objects based on their internal OpenMaya.MObject node compatibility with type constants from OpenMaya.MFn.

Parameters:
  • plugs (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs.
  • filterTypes (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude specific inheriting types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Filtered plugs.

Example

# Returns plugs which reference non-mesh shape nodes
filterPlugsByNodeType(paths, filterTypes=(OpenMaya.MFn.kShape, -OpenMaya.MFn.kMesh))
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getAttributeByName(nodeAttributeName, searchPathsAndNamespaces=False)¶

Return a wrapper of an attribute identified by name.

Parameters:
  • nodeAttributeName (basestring) – Name with format '<node>.<attribute>' used to identify an attribute.
  • searchPathsAndNamespaces (bool, optional) –

    Whether to extend the search to ancestors and namespaces of <node>.

    • If False, <node> must include any identifying path and namespace with format '|:namespace:ancestor|:namespace:child'.
    • If True, <node> can be a short name with format 'child' or a partial path with format 'ancestor|child', in which case the first matching node will be used.

    Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a dependency node attribute could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of an attribute.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getAttributeFromNodeByName(node, attributeName)¶

Return a wrapper of an attribute identified by a dependency node and name.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
  • attributeName (basestring) – Name of an attribute on node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If an attribute on node could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of an attribute.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getNodeByName(nodeName, searchPathsAndNamespaces=False)¶

Return a wrapper of a dependency node identified by name.

Parameters:
  • nodeName (basestring) – Name or path used to identify a node.
  • searchPathsAndNamespaces (bool, optional) –

    Whether to extend the search to ancestors and namespaces of nodeName.

    • If False, nodeName must include any identifying path and namespace with format '|:namespace:ancestor|:namespace:child'.
    • If True, nodeName can be a short name with format 'child' or a partial path with format 'ancestor|child', in which case the first matching node will be returned.

    Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a dependency node could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of a dependency node.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getPathByName(nodeName, searchPathsAndNamespaces=False)¶

Return a path encapsulation of a DAG node identified by name.

Parameters:
  • nodeName (basestring) – Name or path used to identify a path to a node.
  • searchPathsAndNamespaces (bool, optional) –

    Whether to extend the search to ancestors and namespaces of nodeName.

    • If False, nodeName must include any identifying path and namespace with format '|:namespace:ancestor|:namespace:child'.
    • If True, nodeName can be a short name with format 'child' or a partial path with format 'ancestor|child', in which case the first matching path will be returned.

    Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a DAG node could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Path encapsulation of a DAG node.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getPathFromNode(node, instanceNumber=0)¶

Return a path encapsulation of a DAG node identified by instance number.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a DAG node.
  • instanceNumber (int, optional) – Instance number used by the path encapsulation of node. Defaults to 0.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a DAG node.
  • ValueError – If there is no instance of node with corresponding instanceNumber.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MDagPath – Path encapsulation of node with corresponding instanceNumber.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getPlugByName(nodePlugName, searchPathsAndNamespaces=False)¶

Return a plug encapsulation of a dependency node plug identified by name.

Parameters:
  • nodePlugName (basestring) – Name with format '<node>.<plug>' used to identify a plug. The <plug> name should identify a unique plug on <node> by providing all element indices in the plug path using the format 'element[0].child'.
  • searchPathsAndNamespaces (bool, optional) –

    Whether to extend the search to ancestors and namespaces of <node>.

    • If False, <node> must include any identifying path and namespace with format '|:namespace:ancestor|:namespace:child'.
    • If True, <node> can be a short name with format 'child' or a partial path with format 'ancestor|child', in which case the first matching node will be used.

    Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a dependency node plug could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.getPlugFromNodeByName(node, plugName)¶

Return a plug encapsulation of a dependency node plug identified by a node and an associated plug name.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
  • plugName (basestring) – Name used to identify a plug on node. It should identify a unique plug on node by providing all element indices in the plug path using the format 'element[0].child'.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If a dependency node plug could not be identified.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug on node.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.hasCompatibleType(obj, types=None)¶

Check if an object which holds a reference to an internal Maya object is compatible with at least one of the given type constants.

Note

The functionality of OpenMaya.MObject.hasFn() differs to OpenMaya.MDagPath.hasFn(). See the above OpenMaya.MDagPath note-1.

Parameters:
  • obj (OpenMaya.MObject | OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Wrapper of an internal Maya object or path to a DAG node.
  • types (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn representing object and Function Set types used to determine the compatibility of obj. Exclusions can be given as negated type constants making it is possible to exclude certain derived Function Set types such as kMesh. Defaults to None - no type filtering will occur.
Returns:

bool – True if obj is compatible with at least one of the types or types is None, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.inspectTypes(types=None)¶

Split type constants from OpenMaya.MFn into negative and non-negative groups. Used by operations which check the compatibility of internal Maya objects with object and function-set types.

Parameters:types (iterable [int], optional) – Type constants from OpenMaya.MFn representing object and function-set types. Non-negative type constants are ususally used to represent accepted types when checking for compatibility. Negative type constants are usually used to represent excluded types when checking for compatibility. Defaults to None.
Returns:((int, …), (int, …)) – A two-element tuple.
  1. A tuple containing non-negative type constants from types.
  2. A tuple containing negative type constants from types.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.isValidObject(handle, checkAlive=False)¶

Check if an internal Maya object is valid or internally alive.

Note

An internal Maya node is considered valid if it exists in the dependency graph. An invalid Maya object can still be internally alive if it is registered within the internal scene table. For example a Maya node which exists in the undo queue will be considered invalid but alive because it exists in the scene table but not the graph.

Parameters:
  • handle (OpenMaya.MObjectHandle [OpenMaya.MObject]) – Validation wrapper initialised by a wrapper of an internal Maya object.
  • checkAlive (bool, optional) – Whether to check the scene table registry if the internal Maya object is invalid. Defaults to False.
Returns:bool – True if the following conditions are valid:
  1. The internal Maya object referenced by handle is valid if checkAlive is False.
  2. The internal Maya object referenced by handle is alive if checkAlive is True.

Otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.isValidObjectWrapper(obj)¶

Check if an OpenMaya.MObject wrapper of an internal Maya object is functionally valid in terms of its reference.

Note

Functionally valid implies the internal state of the OpenMaya.MObject will be disregarded. Additional checks will be completed to resolve the above OpenMaya.MObject warning-1.

Parameters:obj (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of an internal Maya object.
Returns:bool – True if the reference held by obj to an internal Maya object is functionally valid, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.isValidPath(path)¶

Check if an OpenMaya.MDagPath is functionally valid in terms of its OpenMaya.MObject reference to a dependency node.

Note

Functionally valid implies the internal state of the OpenMaya.MDagPath will be disregarded. Additional checks will be completed to resolve the above OpenMaya.MDagPath warning-1.

Parameters:path (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path encapsulation of a DAG node.
Returns:bool – True if the DAG node reference held by path is functionally valid, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.isValidPlug(plug)¶

Check if an OpenMaya.MPlug is functionally valid in terms of its logical indices and OpenMaya.MObject references to a dependency node and attribute.

Note

Functionally valid implies the internal state of the OpenMaya.MPlug will be disregarded. Additional checks will be completed to resolve the above OpenMaya.MPlug warning-1, warning-2 and warning-3.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Returns:bool – True if the following conditions are valid:
  1. The logical indices of plug are non-negative.
  2. The references held by plug to an internal node and attribute are both functionally valid.
  3. The references held by plug to an internal node and attribute are both related.

Otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.iterAttributesFromNode(node)¶

Yield wrappers for the attributes of a dependency node.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of the attributes on node.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.iterAttributesFromNodeByProperties(node, **kwargs)¶

Yield wrappers for the attributes of a dependency node which correspond to the given properties.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a readable property on OpenMaya.MFnAttribute such as keyable, channelBox, hidden, storable, readable, writable, connectable, array. An attribute will be returned if the value assigned to each keyword argument corresponds to the value of the corresponding attribute property.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of attributes on node.

Examples

# Iterate over all dynamic attributes that exist on `node` which are also unreadable
iterAttributesFromNodeByProperties(node, dynamic=True, readable=False)

# Iterate over all static attributes that exist on `node` which are also keyable
iterAttributesFromNodeByProperties(node, dynamic=False, keyable=True)
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.iterPlugsFromNode(node, forceInitialElements=False)¶

Yield plug encapsulations for the attributes of a dependency node.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
  • forceInitialElements (bool, optional) – Whether to traverse the zeroth indexed element of each array plug if no elements have been assigned. If False, traversal of a plug’s descendant hierarchy will terminate upon reaching an array plug that has no in-use elements. If True, it is guaranteed that the full descendant hierarchy of each plug will be traversed. Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs on node.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.validateAttributeType(attribute, attributeType=561)¶

Validate an OpenMaya.MObject by checking if it references a certain type of attribute.

Parameters:
  • attribute (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of an attribute.
  • attributeType (int, optional) – Type constant from OpenMaya.MFn representing the expected attribute type of attr. Defaults to OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute - the base type for all attributes.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If attr is not compatible with attributeType.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.validateComponentType(component, componentType=531)¶

Validate an OpenMaya.MObject by checking if it references a certain type of component.

Parameters:
  • component (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component.
  • componentType (int, optional) – Type constant from OpenMaya.MFn representing the expected component type of component. Defaults to OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent - the base type for all components.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If component is not compatible with componentType.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.validateNodeType(node, nodeType=4, nodeTypeId=None)¶

Validate an OpenMaya.MObject by checking if it references a certain type of dependency node.

Parameters:
  • node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
  • nodeType (int, optional) – Type constant from OpenMaya.MFn representing the expected node type of node. Defaults to OpenMaya.MFn.kDependencyNode - the base type for all dependency nodes.
  • nodeTypeId (OpenMaya.MTypeId, optional) – Unique node type identifier representing the expected node type of node. Defaults to None - the OpenMaya.MTypeId is not validated.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node is not compatible with nodeType.
  • ValueError – If nodeTypeId is not None and does not reference a registered node type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If nodeTypeId is not None and node does not have a corresponding OpenMaya.MTypeId.
msTools.core.maya.om_utils.validatePlugType(plug, isArray=None, isCompound=None)¶

Validate an OpenMaya.MPlug by checking if it references a certain type of dependency node plug.

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MObject) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
  • isArray (bool, optional) – Whether plug is expected to be an array. Defaults to None - no array expectation.
  • isCompound (bool, optional) – Whether plug is expected to be a compound. Defaults to None - no compound expectation.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If isCompound and isArray are both None.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug does not represent the expectations of isCompound and isArray.
